result.execSummary:
The defendant Anitra L. Pemma was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • 946.41 Resisting or Obstructing Officer. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant must obtain GED.

The defendant may not consume/possess any alcohol.

The defendant may not enter into any bar/taverns.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

records.addlTxt: revoked - sentenced to time served

Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Anitra L. Pemma in court/custody with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 10:26 am. Also called 14CF15. Accurate - no correction. Revocation joint recommendation time served Cirilli 4 month jail sentence with time served  Pemma withholds statement. Court sentences to following on 14CF15 - count 2 & 3 122 days Forest Co jail concurrent to each other, good time and huber - 92 days credit - time served. Civil judgment if any remaining amounts owed. Appeal rights. 14CF141 same appearances. Court has plea questionnaire count 2 amend to mis bail jump, nc $1000 plus costs will pay w/in 30 days. State agrees. Pemma agrees. Court 1,3 4 & 5 DRI. Count 2 amend to mis bail jump. Court reads new charge - pleads NC - court goes thru questionnaire and finds that defendant is entering plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently by entering plea and waiving right to JT, factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges guility of count 2 as amended. Cirilli/Bednar follow joint recommendation. Pemma withholds statement. Court sentences to following. Count 2 fine of $1000 plus costs $1713.00 30 DTP/CO. Appeal rights given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 21, 2015 at 10:15 am.

Called at 1:26 PM. Also called 14CF141. Anitra Pemma appears in person and in custody without counsel. State appears by Charles Simono. Court puts off record conversations on the record. Pemma makes statement as to why she has not been able to retain Gary Cirilli. State responds - Cirilli has indicated to the State that he has not yet been retained. Court will only adjourn these matters one more time, if the defendant does not appear with an attorney at the next hearing date, judge will consider that she is waiving/forfeiting her right to an attorney and Court will proceed, gives ramifications of not hiring counsel by the time the next hearing is. Court continues bond on both matters, set this matter for SEHR on 1/21/15 at 10:15 AM and 14CF141 for AIA on 1/21/15 at 10:15 AM.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 8, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
per telephone conversation with Gary Cirilli's office - he has not been contacted to represent this defendant for the revocation of probation
Sent copy to JA for scheduling
not entered by FOSO - already in custody
of non-payment application for commitment order/license suspension

Defendant Anitra L. Pemma in court with attorney Gary S Cirilli.  Charles J Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 1:45 pm. Resolved. State amend count 1 to FC obstructing with $1000 plus costs, counts 2&3 to mis bail jumping w/held and probation for 1 year with conditons of AODA, 100 hrs co service, no entry/possess consumption. Court amends count 1 to FC bail jumping pleads NC court finds G fine of $1000 plus costs apply bond 60 DTP/CO. Count 2 amend to mis 946.49(1)(a) bail jumping court reads new charge/penalties pleads NC, count 3 amend to same thing pleads NC. Court goes thru plea questionnaire and finds that defendant is pleading freely, voluntarily and intelligently by entering her plea and waiving her right to JT, factual basis, adjudges G of counts 2 & 3 as amended. State/Cirilli statements follow joint recommendation. Pemma withholds statement. Court sentences to following:

Count 2 - w/hold sentence and place on probation for 1 year with conditions of costs - DNAA surcharge - AODA and follow thru - 100 hrs of community service - no entry/possess or consumption of alcohol - emp/school with verbage (3 wkly)  - obtain GED. 

Count 3 - w/hold sentence and place on probation for 1 year concurrent to count 2 with same conditions as count 2 - costs and no additional community service hours or surcharge.

Final pre-trial on July 2, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Called at 10:36 AM. Anitra Pemma does not appear but her attorney Gary Cirilli does appear. State appears by JBC. Cirilli not sure where his client, asks for adjournment. State - no objections. Court forfeits bond, issues bench warrant body or $500.00.
to state's demand for discovery

Final pre-trial on April 30, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Called at 3:13 PM. Anitra Pemma appears in person and in custody with attorney Gary Cirilli. State appears by Charles Simono. State has filed an Information that mirrors the complaint in anticipation of a waiver of the PH. Cirilli and Pemma agree. Court goes thru waiver of PH form, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Cirilli has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN, enters NG plea to all counts. Court accepts plea, continues bond, set for FPT. Set for FPT on 4/30/14 at 10:00 AM.

Called at 10:21 AM. Anita Pemma appears in person and in custody with attorney Gary Cirilli. State apepars by Charles Simono. Cirilli has complaint, waives reading of it, requests PH and need within 20 days. Court continues bond, set for PH on 3/12/14 at 3:00 PM.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 26, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Anitra L. Pemma not in court in custody appears via video, defendant in custody without counsel.  Charles J. Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:29 am. Has not received complaint. Court reads complaint, rights and right to atty. Doesn't want attorney and asks questions of the court regarding Langlade Co case. Now wants attorney. Defendant indicates that she had SPD appointment in Langlade. Court instructs to contact SPD if not can ask court appoint attorney. Court call SPD today. Bond continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 26, 2014 at 09:00 am.
